protocol_name: Calculating the internal bacterial load of Drosophila
protocol_name_html: Calculating the internal bacterial load of Drosophila
description: This protocol is part of the manuscript: Gonçalves et al. Commensal bacteria and essential amino acids control food choice behavior and reproduction. Plos Biology. 2017 Apr 18.
before_start: All reagents (1x PBS) and materials (pestles, beads) used in this protocol need to be sterile.
protocol_affiliation: Champalimaud Centre for the Unknown, School of Biological Sciences
manuscript_citation: Leitão-Gonçalves R, Carvalho-Santos Z, Francisco AP, Fioreze GT, Anjos M, Baltazar C, Elias AP, Itskov PM, Piper MDW, Ribeiro C, Commensal bacteria and essential amino acids control food choice behavior and reproduction. PLoS Biology 15(4). doi: 10.1371/journal.pbio.2000862
keywords: Drosophila, holidic medium, axenic, gnotobiotic, feeding behavior, feeding decisions, microbiota, diet, nutrients

components.data: Prepare enough MRS, mannitol and LB plates to perform at least 3 replicates of at least 2 dilutions per condition, according to the Guidelines in Growing Drosophila gut bacteria protocol.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare enough MRS, mannitol and LB plates to perform at least 3 replicates of at least 2 dilutions per condition, according to the Guidelines in Growing Drosophila gut bacteria protocol.

components.data:
Take these Eppendorf tubes to the flow hood and process all conditions in parallel.

 

The next steps are performed in a laminar flow hood and all reagents and material need to be sterile.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Take these Eppendorf tubes to the flow hood and process all conditions in parallel.

 

The next steps are performed in a laminar flow hood and all reagents and material need to be sterile.

components.data: Sample preparatio
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 70% ethanol to the Eppendorf tube and invert it multiple times during one minute to surface sterilize the flies.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 70% ethanol to the Eppendorf tube and invert it multiple times during one minute to surface sterilize the flies.

components.data: Remove the ethanol.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the ethanol.

components.data: Sample preparation - Washing flies
components.name: Section

components.data: Add sterile 1x PBS, mix well and remove.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add sterile 1x PBS, mix well and remove.

components.data: Sample preparation - Washing flies
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 100 µl of 1x PBS to each Eppendorf tube (EppA) and homogenize using a sterile pestle until there are no intact flies and the sample looks homogeneous.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 100 µl of 1x PBS to each Eppendorf tube (EppA) and homogenize using a sterile pestle until there are no intact flies and the sample looks homogeneous.

components.data: Sample preparation - Homogenizingflies
components.name: Section

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 9 of Calculating the internal bacterial load of flies
source_data.protocol_name: Calculating the internal bacterial load of Drosophila
source_data.protocol_name_html: Calculating the internal bacterial load of Drosophila
source_data.annotation: We start the homogenization with a smaller volume so that the PBS does not spill out of the Eppendorf tube.
source_data.thread_text: We start the homogenization with a smaller volume so that the PBS does not spill out of the Eppendorf tube.
source_data.body: We start the homogenization with a smaller volume so that the PBS does not spill out of the Eppendorf tube.

components.data: Wait that the debris sink. This can take up to 5-10 minutes. Use this time to process the next conditions.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wait that the debris sink. This can take up to 5-10 minutes. Use this time to process the next conditions.

components.data: Sample preparation - Homogenizing flies
components.name: Section

components.data: Do serial dilutions (1:100 and 1:1000) for each condition as follows in the next steps.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Do serial dilutions (1:100 and 1:1000) for each condition as follows in the next steps.

components.data: Serial dilutions
components.name: Section

components.data: To make a 1:100 dilution, pipette 100 μl from EppB tube to a 15 ml Falcon tube and add 9900 ul of 1x PBS.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: To make a 1:100 dilution, pipette 100 μl from EppB tube to a 15 ml Falcon tube and add 9900 ul of 1x PBS.

components.data: Serial dilutions
components.name: Section

components.data: To inoculate the plates transfer 50 μl solution from the corresponding Falcon tube onto the plate making sure the liquid is distributed over its surface.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: To inoculate the plates transfer 50 μl solution from the corresponding Falcon tube onto the plate making sure the liquid is distributed over its surface.

components.data: Inoculation of the plates with bacteria
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Inoculation of the plates with bacteria

components.data: Transfer sterile glass beads to the plates, stack 4-5 plates containing the beads and shake them vigorously in all horizontal directions until the sample covers the plate surface evenly.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer sterile glass beads to the plates, stack 4-5 plates containing the beads and shake them vigorously in all horizontal directions until the sample covers the plate surface evenly.

components.data: Inoculation of the plates with bacteria
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Inoculation of the plates with bacteria

components.data: Remove the beads by just opening the lid the minimum amount necessary to avoid contamination.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the beads by just opening the lid the minimum amount necessary to avoid contamination.

components.data: Inoculation of the plates with bacteria
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Inoculation of the plates with bacteria

components.data: Repeat steps 17-19 in this section for all conditions/dilutions.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Repeat steps 17-19 in this section for all conditions/dilutions.

components.data: Inoculation of the plates with bacteria
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Inoculation of the plates with bacteria

components.data: Incubate MRS plates at 37ºC for 48h, LB plates at 37ºC for 24h, and Mannitol plates at 30º C for 24h. It is advisable to check the plates before the full time has elapsed to avoid an overgrowth of the culture due to a high amount of colonies which could preclude counting separate colonies.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate MRS plates at 37ºC for 48h, LB plates at 37ºC for 24h, and Mannitol plates at 30º C for 24h. It is advisable to check the plates before the full time has elapsed to avoid an overgrowth of the culture due to a high amount of colonies which could preclude counting separate colonies.

components.data: Inoculation of the plates with bacteria

source_data.section: Inoculation of the plates with bacteria

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 20 of Calculating the internal bacterial load of Drosophila
source_data.protocol_name: Calculating the internal bacterial load of Drosophila
source_data.protocol_name_html: Calculating the internal bacterial load of Drosophila
source_data.annotation: Much longer incubation times can lead to the appearance of unspecific colonies from other than the 5 bacteria being surveyed by this protocol. This is especially the case when using non gnotobiotic flies.
source_data.thread_text: Much longer incubation times can lead to the appearance of unspecific colonies from other than the 5 bacteria being surveyed by this protocol. This is especially the case when using non gnotobiotic flies.
source_data.body: Much longer incubation times can lead to the appearance of unspecific colonies from other than the 5 bacteria being surveyed by this protocol. This is especially the case when using non gnotobiotic flies.

components.data:
Count the number of colonies in each plate making sure that the plate only contains separated, well defined single colonies. Calculate the CFU/fly for every plate using the following formulas:

 

  • CFU/ml = ((total number of colonies on a plate) * (dilution factor (100 or 1000) * 1,8)) / (plated volume)
  • CFU/fly = ((CFU/ml) * total volume in EppA)) / (number of flies per condition)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Count the number of colonies in each plate making sure that the plate only contains separated, well defined single colonies. Calculate the CFU/fly for every plate using the following formulas:

 

  • CFU/ml = ((total number of colonies on a plate) * (dilution factor (100 or 1000) * 1,8)) / (plated volume)
  • CFU/fly = ((CFU/ml) * total volume in EppA)) / (number of flies per condition)

components.data: Calculation of bacterial CFU
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 400 μl of 1x PBS to each Eppendorf tube for a total volume of 500 μl of sample.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 400 μl of 1x PBS to each Eppendorf tube for a total volume of 500 μl of sample.

components.data: Sample preparation - Homogenizing flies
components.name: Section

components.data: Prepare a new Eppendorf tube (Epp B) for each condition.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare a new Eppendorf tube (Epp B) for each condition.

components.data: Sample preparation - Homogenizing flies
components.name: Section

components.data: Pipette 250 μl of supernatant from the EppA solution into EppB and add 200 μl of 1x PBS to EppB. If you are not able to pipette 250 μl of the samples without taking a lot of debris, you should wait until the samples settle a bit more.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pipette 250 μl of supernatant from the EppA solution into EppB and add 200 μl of 1x PBS to EppB. If you are not able to pipette 250 μl of the samples without taking a lot of debris, you should wait until the samples settle a bit more.

components.data: Sample preparation - Homogenizing flies
components.name: Section

components.data: At this stage every EppB should contain the final volume of 450 μl.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: At this stage every EppB should contain the final volume of 450 μl.

components.data: Sample preparation - Homogenizing flies
components.name: Section

components.data: To make a 1:1000 dilution, pipette 1 ml from the 1:100 dilution to a 15 ml Falcon tube and add 9 ml of 1x PBS.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: To make a 1:1000 dilution, pipette 1 ml from the 1:100 dilution to a 15 ml Falcon tube and add 9 ml of 1x PBS.

components.data: Serial dilutions
components.name: Section

components.data: Repeat step 6 once.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Repeat step 6 once.
